field.description: The part of organism's anatomy or substance arising from an organism (which belongs to the defined "Unit of observation" of the experiment) from which the biomaterial was derived for the particular assay. E.g. tissue, organ, system, plant product.

ontology.name: BRENDA Tissue and Enzyme Source Ontology

field.description: an identifier to the Assay Node. It is used in data files as row identifier for the matrix of observations of the form 'Assay by Trait'
Name (or URI) of the raw data file generated by an assay. No format restrictions.

Name or URI of the file containing definitions of phenotypic traits measured in this assay. Each row of TDF contains a definition of one trait in the form: Trait Name, Method Description, Scale (units). Trait names are used in data files as names of columns with observation.

Name (or URI) of the derived data file generated from raw data by data processing. The file should be in the form of a 'Assay x Traits' matrix, where traits (i.e. columns) correspond to trait names (i.e. rows) from Trait Definition File. There is one column for each trait with continuous measurement (Trait value[<Trait Name>]) and three columns for each categorical trait (Trait value[<Trait Name>], Term Source Ref, Term Accession Number).
